title: "I'm fine." Cue tears.
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OQpUJ0

by Lou_La

Peter and Harley are Tony Stark and Steve Rogers’ adopted sons. Peter, being slightly older, is seen as the adult. He gets less attention. When Peter gets bitten, no-one notices.

When Peter gets perfect scores and gets into MIT, no-one notices.

When Peter comes back hurt, no one notices.

Only when Peter dies, do they notice.

summary: Chapter 7 of “Heroes are Easy, People are Hard” is up!
title: Chapter 7 of “Heroes are Easy, People are Hard” is up!
body:
In the homestretch and totally not panicking. Read as I write with feverish abandon!  It’s on Ao3.

Excerpt:

“I remember when I was a kid, we went to the Stark Expo.” Bucky’s face did the thing again, but he didn’t seem to have questions, so Peter kept going. “There—well, actually, the first time we went, I didn’t get to see much. That was when it all went wrong and things started blowing up. One of the Hammer drones actually came right at me—I was wearing an Iron Man costume, ’cause I was really into Iron Man as a kid” (he had to admit that) “and I kind of, you know, did the thing”—he pushed out with one hand—“because that’s just what my brain decided to do, only then the drone does blow up, like FOOM! And I looked up and Mr. Stark was standing right next to me. He said thanks for the help. And then he flew off.” Peter flopped back against the chair. “And then we got ice cream.” 

Bucky was staring at him, slack-jawed.

summary: Happy 2k Jen! I’m so proud and happy for you! ! ! You deserve it so much  Could you write me something with Pietro Maximoff (or...
question: Happy 2k Jen! I’m so proud and happy for you! ! ! You deserve it so much  Could you write me something with Pietro Maximoff (or Clint Barton or Bruce Banner) set in NY avengers tower, happy everyone lives AU where the reader has a bad day and they cheer her up? I need some happiness in my life right now. Please and thank you 🙏🏼 and again congratulations on 2k (you deserve way more but we still have time) and let’s get this party started!!! i love u 💓
answer:
Title: Bad, Bad Day

Summary: You were having a bad day and the Avengers agreed to do everything to cheer you up.

Pairing:  Platonic! Avengers x Reader

Warning: None

Genre: Fluff

A/N: @potter-thinking I hope I got it right *I’m praying to Loki*

v-2bucky 2k Celebration Request Guide

-You felt shit when you returned at the Avengers Tower which was previously known as Stark Tower. Pietro smiled widely when he saw you in the kitchen but you ignored him.

-The Quiksilver has a huge crush on you but he was scared to make a move since he was scared that you will turn him down.

-Since he hates to see you sad or grumpy. He informed Tony that he thinks that you are having a bad day.

-All of the Avengers love you so much since you are their sunshine. You always brighten up their day, make them laugh, and you never fail to put a smile on their faces. Yes, even Nat or the God of Mischief himself, Loki.

-Tony called everyone in the conference room and informed them about the crisis that they are facing. The Avengers little sunshine was having a bad day.

-Clint was feeling competitive that day and he dared everyone in the conference room. Whoever can cheer you up can make one wish to others. Loki immediately claimed that he will win. Tony suggested that everyone can only try once. All of them agreed.

-Tony was the first one who tried to cheer you up. He asked you what do you want? New car? New gadget? A plane? Shopping spree? You took a deep sighed before looking at him with boring eyes. You told him that he can’t buy what you wanted. This made the billionaire genius shocked and left speechless.

-Steve doesn’t know how to cheer you up but he got to try. You’re always nice to him even when the first time you met. He always laughs at your corny and old jokes. He asked you what was the problem and offered to take you out for ice cream. You just gave him a small smile and lied that you are fine.

-Bucky and Sam agreed to team up this time because they thought that two heads are better than one.  Sam told you a lot of jokes while Bucky prepared your favorite comfort foods. You thanked them for their efforts and eat silently. Sam attempted to cheer you up again but Nat warned him.

-Thor shared his precious pop tarts to you and waited for you to cheer up. Sadly, he failed easily.

-Bruce was not good at cheering up people. He talked to you privately, he informed you that everyone was worried about you. He made a joke that he will let the other guy come out if you don’t cheer up. You ran out of the lab screaming and crying.

-Nat asked you who does she need to kill to cheer you up. She looked serious so you ran away from her.

-Wanda tried to read your mind to find out what was the problem. Since you had the same ability as her, you got mad at her instead.

-Loki lends you his helmet and reads you bunch of Asgardian books. You ended up falling asleep, he immediately bragged to everyone that he already won. He was surprised to find you grumpier when you woke up.

-Clint was a father figure to you. He used it to his advantage to find out what was the problem. You ignored him and didn’t say a word.

-Pietro asked you where do you want to go but you informed him that you are tired and you had a bad day.

-Peter went to the living room and he was surprised that all of the Avengers were there. All of them looked like they lost something. He showed a cute white cat to everyone. You snatched the cat from him and told him that it was your missing cat.

-All of the Avengers looked at you. You explained that you are really having a bad day. It started when you went to a bookstore to buy the book that you always wanted. You went to all the bookstore that you know but they don’t have it. You also tried to find it online but it was sold out. The next one was when your white kitten got lost. Tony warned you that pets are not allowed in the tower that’s why you kept the cat hidden from everyone and never a single word about it. The other thing that ruined your day was when you lost your wallet and all the  other misfortunes that you experience today.

-Peter looked at you and gave you a small hug. He suggested that you should all watch a movie and eat a lot. You immediately smiled at him, you thanked him for finding your cat. Tony allowed you to keep the cat and called a publishing company to get you the book that you always wanted. He finally realized that he can’t really replace your beloved cat and surrender.

-“So… Peter won?” Clint looked at everyone. You and Peter looked at each other wondering what he was talking about.

-“He is not here when we agreed to cheer Y/N up, no one won” Loki announced.

-Later that night, Pietro finally asked you out but the moment got ruined when everyone came in with blankets, pillows, and foods.

-“Movie time!” Peter announced, “what are we going to watch?”

-“My secret collection” you stood up and announced, “it is called the Avengers funny moments”.


A/N: Let me know if you are not receiving notification or you want to be removed from the tag list. Comments and reblogs are very much appreciated.

Permanent list:  @galaxies-inside-my-head @httpmcrvel @potter-thinking @theoneanna @smexylemony @forext20 @thefridgeismybestie @logical-spider @not-zari-tak @schizophrenicstoryteller @theblueinyour-eyes @thehuntress26 @paintballkid711 @berruneko09 @yeahbutmarvel @untoldshortsofthefandoms @crazybutconfidentaf @spn-marvel-nerd @chonisberonica @breezy1415 @youtubehelpsmesurvive @gaybroadwayloser @thisismysecrethappyplace @lovingauthorpeachnerd @obsessedfangirl4lyfe @nessieaceman @unhealthyobsessionwithmarvel @letthembehappymcu @billymandykristoff @glitteryanimegiftokyoghoulalmond @mistressnya @maladaptive-ninja-returns @nighthybrid3199

-Steve doesn’t know how to cheer you up but he got to try. You’re always nice to him even when the first time you met. He always laughs at your corny and old jokes. -Bucky and Sam agreed to team up this time because they thought that two heads are better than one.  Sam told you a lot of jokes while Bucky prepared your favorite comfort foods. You thanked them for their efforts and eat silently. Sam attempted to cheer you up again but Nat warned him.

-Bruce was not good at cheering up people. He talked to you privately, he informed you that everyone was worried about you. He made a joke that he will let the other guy come out if you don’t cheer up. You ran out of the lab screaming and crying.

-Wanda tried to read your mind to find out what was the problem. Since you had the same ability as her, you got mad at her instead.

-Loki lends you his helmet and reads you bunch of Asgardian books. You ended up falling asleep, he immediately bragged to everyone that he already won. He was surprised to find you grumpier when you woke up.

-Clint was a father figure to you. He used it to his advantage to find out what was the problem. You ignored him and didn’t say a word.

-All of the Avengers looked at you. You explained that you are really having a bad day. It started when you went to a bookstore to buy the book that you always wanted. title: SotF Chapter 19 Preview
body:
Behind?  Catch up on AO3/ FFN :)

As always, a huge shout-out to @stjohn27, my prereader and sounding board.  ❤️


As he slowly began to regain the feeling in his limbs, partially frozen from the cold and numb from the awkward position of his body, Peter came to the conclusion that he was in fact lying flat on his stomach on a very cold, very hard, grated metal floor.  The right side of his head—throbbing in perfect rhythm with the very loud thudding of his heart—itched something crazy, and Peter groaned as he attempted to move his hand up to scratch at the itch.

“Uh, I wouldn’t do that yet, kid,” an unfamiliar voice suddenly said from down by Peter’s feet.  Peter immediately froze, his hand comically hovering in midair.  “You really should take it slow, you’re still pretty out of it.”

“Aahh!” Peter cried, opening his eyes in the dim light of the grey metal room just enough to see the outline of an unfamiliar man with brown hair and chin stubble sitting on the floor in the opposite corner, dressed in some kind of blue jumpsuit.  Peter grimaced as the throbbing in his head got even worse, and he squeezed his eyes back closed.  “Who’re you?”

“It’s okay, kid,” the man’s voice said.  “I’m not gonna hurt you.”  Peter felt the man’s large hand take his own, placing it gently back down onto the floor next to his itchy head.  “You got a pretty nasty cut there on the side of your head, but it’s already healed up a bunch since they brought you in here, so I think you’re gonna be okay.  Just… don’t try and move too much yet.”

Peter nodded, or at least nodded as well as he could while lying flat on his face.  Just the small movement of his hand and arm had caused his stomach to start doing somersaults, so he wasn’t really in a hurry to try again anyway.  Not yet at least.

“Who’re you?” Peter asked again, trying to sound more calm than he felt.  “Where’s my dad?  Where’re Steve and Natasha and Sam and—”

“Shh,” the man said.  “Just try and stay quiet for a bit, okay?”  He gently patted Peter’s back, and the kind, comforting gesture reminded Peter so much of his father that tears welled up in his eyes and started rolling down the side of his face.

“Oh no,” the man said, stilling his hand.  “Now see, I didn’t mean to make ya cry, kid.  I didn’t mean that at all.  Oh no.  I’m so sorry!  Um…”

“No, it’s okay,” Peter rasped, sniffing.  He raised his hand, smearing the tears across his cheek.  “It’s okay.  Who are you?”

“My name’s Scott,” the man replied.  He patted Peter’s back again.  “Scott Lang.  And you are?”

“Peter,” replied Peter.  “Peter Parker Stark.”

“Oh… shit,” Scott whispered, withdrawing his hand.  “Uhh… as in, the Starks?  Like, those really rich people who own that huge… ah… warehouse up there in upstate New York?  As in, the Iron Man Starks?”

“Warehouse?” Peter muttered.  “No, it’s not a warehouse.  That’s the Comp—, oohh.”  Flattening his palm on the floor, Peter pushed his head up just enough so that he could get a better look at the man’s face.  “You’re the one who broke into the Compound?  Who wrecked Sam’s Falcon pack?”

“Um… yeah,” Scott replied sheepishly, swallowing hard.  “Yeah, that was me.  Yep, it sure was.”

“That really wasn’t nice!” exclaimed Peter, a lot louder than he’d intended as a sharp bolt of pain shot through the side of his head, right across where it was itching.  He immediately clapped his palm over the spot, pressing against it.  “Ow!  This hurts!”


The full chapter will post on Monday, October 29th :)

“Shh,” the man said.  “Just try and stay quiet for a bit, okay?”  He gently patted Peter’s back, and the kind, comforting gesture reminded Peter so much of his father that tears welled up in his eyes and started rolling down the side of his face.

“Oh no,” the man said, stilling his hand.  “Now see, I didn’t mean to make ya cry, kid.  I didn’t mean that at all.  Oh no.  I’m so sorry!  Um…”

“No, it’s okay,” Peter rasped, sniffing.  He raised his hand, smearing the tears across his cheek.  “It’s okay.  Who are you?”

“My name’s Scott,” the man replied.  He patted Peter’s back again.  “Scott Lang.  And you are?”

“Peter,” replied Peter.  “Peter Parker Stark.”

“Oh… shit,” Scott whispered, withdrawing his hand.  “Uhh… as in, the Starks?  Like, those really rich people who own that huge… ah… warehouse up there in upstate New York?  As in, the Iron Man Starks?”

“Warehouse?” Peter muttered.  “No, it’s not a warehouse.  That’s the Comp—, oohh.”  Flattening his palm on the floor, Peter pushed his head up just enough so that he could get a better look at the man’s face.  “You’re the one who broke into the Compound?  Who wrecked Sam’s Falcon pack?”

“Um… yeah,” Scott replied sheepishly, swallowing hard.  “Yeah, that was me.  Yep, it sure was.”

“That really wasn’t nice!” exclaimed Peter, a lot louder than he’d intended as a sharp bolt of pain shot through the side of his head, right across where it was itching.  He immediately clapped his palm over the spot, pressing against it.  “Ow!  This hurts!”


The full chapter will post on Monday, October 29th :)

summary: I was just thinking about how all these posts and fanfics and everything that talk about Tony adopting all these kids that he...
question: I was just thinking about how all these posts and fanfics and everything that talk about Tony adopting all these kids that he meets but what would make more sense is the kids adopting Tony...
answer:
I mean. It’s a mutual kind of adoption, isn’t it? Otherwise, it’d also be really fucking weird. If there’s just this Older Man who decides to adopt you and you’re like “Uh, no, sir??”. xDDD

I love the fanon idea of Shuri just going “Ooooh, another shiny broken white boy! Dibs!”. *snickers*

I just want Tony to be surrounded by people who love and respect him??

summary:
Imagine Tony finding out that you, his
dead girlfriend, was killed by the Winter Soldier - - - - - Masterlist / Ko-Fi - - - - - ...
caption:
Imagine Tony finding out that you, his dead girlfriend, was killed by the Winter Soldier

- - - - - Masterlist / Ko-Fi - - - - -

As Tony watched the videos, he couldn’t help but feel both anguished and enrages and as he watched the two clips. In the first, he sees Bucky kill his parents, his father beaten and his mother asphyxiated, while in the second, he sees him shoot [Name], his old girlfriend. He had always wondered how [Name] died; no suspect was ever found and the case ended up cold but seeing now how the person who was once the love of their life die, it was just too much. 

When the two videos end, Tony moves toward Bucky in an attempt to punch him when Steve grabs his arm and stops him.  “No, Tony.”

Tony looks at him in disbelief. “Did you know?” He asks Steve.

Looking him straight in the eyes and with a stern look on his face, Steve answers. “Yes.”

Breaking out of his hold, Tony takes a few steps away from Steve before coming back and punching him.

title: More than a Little Secret (Tumblr Prompt)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PZHCGu

by NanixErka

Howard did a lot more than shame Tony for not being as good as Captain America. In fact, he was so obsessed with the idea that he developed a (rather problematic) version of the super serum and injected Tony with it. Tony hates it. So he’s become almost perfect at hiding its effects… Almost being the key word there.

title: Whumptober Day-10 Bruises
body:
The men that pulled them into the alley are huge. We’re talking Captain America size. There was three of them and they were practically besides themselves with giddiness once they got a good look at their prey. You’d think that they won the criminal jackpot.

Maybe they did. They did just catch Tony Stark without his amour.

Tony guessed that this was the price he paid for spoiling Peter. The plan had been to go to Tony’s favorite steak house to celebrate the kid making honor roll. But, because Tony was wrapped around his pinky finger, all it took was Peter’s off handed mention of his favorite hole in the wall joint that had Tony changing their plans.

He’d even given Happy the night off so that they could walk off their greasy hamburgers. And look where that got them; trading punches with over grown thugs in a dirty alley.

The steak house was on a very well-lit street with no dingy alleys that held criminals in it, just for the record.

Peter was holding his own pretty well. A little too good, in fact. So good that two of guys decided to team up and focus their efforts on bringing him down. Peter played defense, trying to subdue them both without showing too much of his spider hand.

Tony only had one plan. It was entitled: Don’t get killed. Sure, it wasn’t his most detailed plan but improvising was what Tony did best.

He fell back to the boxing pointers that Happy had taught him. He hoped that it would buy him enough brownie points that Hogan wouldn’t kill him himself when this was all over with.

Tony had to say that he was proud of the jab that sent his assailant stumbling away. Too bad it didn’t last long though. The guy angrily shook it off and came storming back towards Tony. His meaty hands wrapped around Tony’s neck and lifted him up off the ground.

Any and all of Tony’s training went out the window in a blind panic.

His hands scrambled and clawed at the thug’s arms. He could fell the skin give way underneath his fingernails and blood trickle down the guy’s arms but it didn’t seem to faze him. A swift kick to the stomach only made him madder.

The guy’s grip tightened and alarm bells rang in Tony’s head.

He couldn’t breathe. He couldn’t breathe. He couldn’t breathe.

Black spots took up most of Tony’s vision as he desperately kept digging his nails into his attacker’s arm. It did nothing but make the hands around him squeeze tighter.

Hazily, Tony thought about Peter. Barely awake, Tony tried to find him. His eyes darted around the alley until he found the kid.

He had one thug on the ground and nearly had the other down too. He hadn’t noticed Tony’s situation. That was probably for the best, Tony thought. He didn’t want the kid seeing this.

He hoped that the kid wouldn’t blame himself for tonight though. Peter had a guilt complex to rival Tony’s.

Tony’s vision blacked out completely. He felt his hand drop down without his permission. Distantly, he thought he heard an angry shout.

“Mr. Stark!”

Than nothing.

***

When Tony blinked back to life, his first coherent thought was how great it was that he could breathe again. The next was that there was a solid weight on his chest. After a moment, he gathered his strength and lifted his neck to see what was on top of him.

It was Peter.

The kid was kneeled beside him, his forehead pressed against the dip of Tony’s sternum. His breaths came out in hot, tired pants against the fabric of Tony’s shirt. Peter’s whole body shook but Tony couldn’t tell if he was crying.

The question was answered for him when Peter turned his head just enough to catch Tony’s eyes, with red but dry eyes of his own.

“Pete,” Tony’s croaked out and instantly winced. His voice sounded horrible and pain radiated down his throat. He wondered if there’d be any permeant damage.

“Don’t try to talk.” Peter’s instructed, his own voice muffled when he turned his head back into Tony’s chest.

Tony looked around the alleyway, trying to fill in the blanks of what happened after he blacked out. All three thugs were unconscious and webbed to the brick wall across from them. They were mostly in one piece expect for the one that attacked Tony.

Spider-Man might not kill people but he’d give them a hell of a beating if you pissed him off enough, apparently.

“I called the police and Cap.” Peter explained. ”He said that he’d try to beat the police here, but I put my web shooters in my backpack though, just in case.”

“Good boy.” Tony whispered hoarsely but proudly, disobeying orders but Peter didn’t say anything. He turned his face back into Tony’s shirt with a half grin that faded away too quickly for Tony’s liking.

After a moment, Peter lifted his head again and gave him a worried frown.

“What’s wrong?”

Peter took out his phone and flipped the front facing camera towards Tony.

Ouch.

No wonder it hurt so much to talk.

Tony’s throat was already littered with a ring of ugly deep purple bruises. It traveled from one side of his neck to the other. Two big violet thumbprints met in the middle, right over his wind pipe.

“Yeah,” Peter grumbled as he put up his phone. “Like I said, don’t talk.”

Tony nodded obediently and Peter laid his head back down, seemingly satisfied.

Tremors still ran through the kid and Tony was kind of surprised that the incident had shaken him up so badly. He’d gotten hurt way worse in front of Peter on missions. And yeah, Peter tended to take any injury that Tony got badly, but this one seemed to really get to him.

Then it hit him like a fright train.

Peter watched his uncle get killed in an alleyway.

Tony blew out a sigh, kicking himself for forgetting. No wonder Peter was tore up over seeing Tony get attacked like that.

Peter tilted his head, questioning, and Tony shook his own head quickly. Silently, he lifted a hand and cupped the back of Peter’s curls then he ran his fingers through Peter’s hair. Tony put everything that he wanted to say but couldn’t into the touch.

They were okay. Peter had saved him. They would be alright.

Peter must have gotten the message because his eyes slipped closed again and he leaned into Tony’s touch. It was a long moment before Peter spoke again.

“That was scary, Mr. Stark.” He said, his voice quiet. Then, “Next time you choose the restaurant.”

Tony couldn’t help the bark of laughter that ripped from his abused throat. He ran his other hand up and down Peter’s back until the boy finally stopped shaking.

They laid like that on the concrete, cold and shivering, but content until the cavalry arrived.

The guy’s grip tightened and alarm bells rang in Tony’s head.

He couldn’t breathe. He couldn’t breathe. He couldn’t breathe.

Black spots took up most of Tony’s vision as he desperately kept digging his nails into his attacker’s arm. It did nothing but make the hands around him squeeze tighter.

Hazily, Tony thought about Peter. Barely awake, Tony tried to find him. His eyes darted around the alley until he found the kid.

He had one thug on the ground and nearly had the other down too. He hadn’t noticed Tony’s situation. That was probably for the best, Tony thought. He didn’t want the kid seeing this.

He hoped that the kid wouldn’t blame himself for tonight though. Peter had a guilt complex to rival Tony’s.

Tony’s vision blacked out completely. He felt his hand drop down without his permission. Distantly, he thought he heard an angry shout.

“Mr. Stark!”

Than nothing.

***

When Tony blinked back to life, his first coherent thought was how great it was that he could breathe again. The next was that there was a solid weight on his chest. After a moment, he gathered his strength and lifted his neck to see what was on top of him.

It was Peter.

The kid was kneeled beside him, his forehead pressed against the dip of Tony’s sternum. His breaths came out in hot, tired pants against the fabric of Tony’s shirt. Peter’s whole body shook but Tony couldn’t tell if he was crying.

The question was answered for him when Peter turned his head just enough to catch Tony’s eyes, with red but dry eyes of his own.

“Pete,” Tony’s croaked out and instantly winced. His voice sounded horrible and pain radiated down his throat. He wondered if there’d be any permeant damage.

“Don’t try to talk.” Peter’s instructed, his own voice muffled when he turned his head back into Tony’s chest.

Tony looked around the alleyway, trying to fill in the blanks of what happened after he blacked out. All three thugs were unconscious and webbed to the brick wall across from them. They were mostly in one piece expect for the one that attacked Tony.

Spider-Man might not kill people but he’d give them a hell of a beating if you pissed him off enough, apparently.

“I called the police and Cap.” Peter explained. ”He said that he’d try to beat the police here, but I put my web shooters in my backpack though, just in case.”

“Good boy.” Tony whispered hoarsely but proudly, disobeying orders but Peter didn’t say anything. He turned his face back into Tony’s shirt with a half grin that faded away too quickly for Tony’s liking.

After a moment, Peter lifted his head again and gave him a worried frown.

“What’s wrong?”

Peter took out his phone and flipped the front facing camera towards Tony.

Ouch.

No wonder it hurt so much to talk.

Tony’s throat was already littered with a ring of ugly deep purple bruises. It traveled from one side of his neck to the other. Two big violet thumbprints met in the middle, right over his wind pipe.

“Yeah,” Peter grumbled as he put up his phone. “Like I said, don’t talk.”

Tony nodded obediently and Peter laid his head back down, seemingly satisfied.

Tremors still ran through the kid and Tony was kind of surprised that the incident had shaken him up so badly. He’d gotten hurt way worse in front of Peter on missions. And yeah, Peter tended to take any injury that Tony got badly, but this one seemed to really get to him.

Then it hit him like a fright train.

Peter watched his uncle get killed in an alleyway.

Tony blew out a sigh, kicking himself for forgetting. No wonder Peter was tore up over seeing Tony get attacked like that.

Peter tilted his head, questioning, and Tony shook his own head quickly. Silently, he lifted a hand and cupped the back of Peter’s curls then he ran his fingers through Peter’s hair. Tony put everything that he wanted to say but couldn’t into the touch.

They were okay. Peter had saved him. They would be alright.

Peter must have gotten the message because his eyes slipped closed again and he leaned into Tony’s touch. It was a long moment before Peter spoke again.

“That was scary, Mr. Stark.” He said, his voice quiet. Then, “Next time you choose the restaurant.”

Tony couldn’t help the bark of laughter that ripped from his abused throat. He ran his other hand up and down Peter’s back until the boy finally stopped shaking.

They laid like that on the concrete, cold and shivering, but content until the cavalry arrived.
trail.content:
The men that pulled them into the alley are huge. We’re talking Captain America size. There was three of them and they were practically besides themselves with giddiness once they got a good look at their prey. You’d think that they won the criminal jackpot.

Maybe they did. They did just catch Tony Stark without his amour.

Tony guessed that this was the price he paid for spoiling Peter. The plan had been to go to Tony’s favorite steak house to celebrate the kid making honor roll. But, because Tony was wrapped around his pinky finger, all it took was Peter’s off handed mention of his favorite hole in the wall joint that had Tony changing their plans.

He’d even given Happy the night off so that they could walk off their greasy hamburgers. And look where that got them; trading punches with over grown thugs in a dirty alley.

The steak house was on a very well-lit street with no dingy alleys that held criminals in it, just for the record.

Peter was holding his own pretty well. A little too good, in fact. So good that two of guys decided to team up and focus their efforts on bringing him down. Peter played defense, trying to subdue them both without showing too much of his spider hand.

Tony only had one plan. It was entitled: Don’t get killed. Sure, it wasn’t his most detailed plan but improvising was what Tony did best.

He fell back to the boxing pointers that Happy had taught him. He hoped that it would buy him enough brownie points that Hogan wouldn’t kill him himself when this was all over with.

Tony had to say that he was proud of the jab that sent his assailant stumbling away. Too bad it didn’t last long though. The guy angrily shook it off and came storming back towards Tony. His meaty hands wrapped around Tony’s neck and lifted him up off the ground.
